definition: the act or result of rendering something: such as
a performance or interpretation of something
examples: a moving rendition of a song
a fine rendition of a classic recipe
… the rusty orange color was an extremely accurate rendition of the Martian soil's appearance.
the first rendition of the text into English

definition: surrender, the surrender by a state of a fugitive to another state charging the fugitive with a crime : interstate extradition, — see also extraordinary rendition
examples: Two city residents wanted in New Jersey on gun charges are being held without bail awaiting rendition to that state.
